save(*args, **kwargs)¶

Save the current instance. Override this in a subclass if you want to control the saving process.

The ‘force_insert’ and ‘force_update’ parameters can be used to insist that the “save” must be an SQL insert or update (or equivalent for non-SQL backends), respectively. Normally, they should not be set.

class projects.models.Marker(*args, **kwargs)¶

This model holds the definition for each unit of annotation in Textinator, called Marker. We create each Marker only when creating a new project and can re-use Markers between the projects.

Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – Id

  • dt_created (DateTimeField) – Creation date, autofilled

  • name (CharField) – The display name of the marker (max 50 characters, must be unique)

  • code (CharField) – Marker’s nickname used internally

  • color (ColorField) – Marker’s color used when annotating the text

  • for_task_type (CharField) – Specify task types (if any) for which this marker must be present (avaiable only to admins)

  • shortcut (CharField) – Keyboard shortcut for annotating a piece of text with this marker

  • actions (ManyToManyField) – Actions associated with each marker [EXPAND]

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
get_count_restrictions(stringify=True)¶

Get the restrictions (if any) on the number of markers per submitted instance

Args:

stringify (bool, optional): Whether to return the restrictions in a string format

Returns:

(str or list): Restrictions on the number of markers per submitted instance

is_part_of_relation()¶

Check whether a given marker is part of definition for any Relation

save(*args, **kwargs)¶

Save the current instance. Override this in a subclass if you want to control the saving process.

The ‘force_insert’ and ‘force_update’ parameters can be used to insist that the “save” must be an SQL insert or update (or equivalent for non-SQL backends), respectively. Normally, they should not be set.

class projects.models.Project(id, dt_created, title, short_description, institution, supported_by, guidelines, reminders, temporary_message, video_summary, sampling_with_replacement, disjoint_annotation, show_dataset_identifiers, context_size, task_type, dt_publish, dt_finish, dt_updated, author, is_open, is_peer_reviewed, allow_selecting_labels, disable_submitted_labels, max_markers_per_input, round_length, points_scope, points_unit, has_intro_tour)¶
Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – Id

  • dt_created (DateTimeField) – Creation date, autofilled

  • title (CharField) – Title

  • short_description (TextField) – Short description

  • institution (CharField) – Institution

  • supported_by (CharField) – Supported by

  • guidelines (HTMLField) – Guidelines

  • reminders (HTMLField) – Reminders

  • temporary_message (HTMLField) – Temporary message

  • video_summary (FileBrowseField) – Video summary

  • sampling_with_replacement (BooleanField) – Sampling with replacement

  • disjoint_annotation (BooleanField) – Disjoint annotation

  • show_dataset_identifiers (BooleanField) – Show dataset identifiers

  • context_size (CharField) – Context size for storing labels

  • task_type (CharField) – Task type

  • dt_publish (DateTimeField) – To be published at

  • dt_finish (DateTimeField) – To be finished at

  • dt_updated (DateTimeField) – Dt updated

  • author_id (ForeignKey to User) – Author

  • is_open (BooleanField) – Is open

  • is_peer_reviewed (BooleanField) – Is peer reviewed

  • allow_selecting_labels (BooleanField) – Allow selecting labels

  • disable_submitted_labels (BooleanField) – Disable submitted labels

  • max_markers_per_input (PositiveIntegerField) – Max markers per input

  • round_length (PositiveIntegerField) – The number of text snippets consituting one round of the game

  • points_scope (CharField) – The scope of the submitted task

  • points_unit (PositiveIntegerField) – Number of points per submitted task

  • has_intro_tour (BooleanField) – Has intro tour

  • collaborators (ManyToManyField) – Collaborators

  • participants (ManyToManyField) – Participants

  • markers (ManyToManyField) – Markers

  • datasources (ManyToManyField) – Datasources

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
save(*args, **kwargs)¶

Save the current instance. Override this in a subclass if you want to control the saving process.

The ‘force_insert’ and ‘force_update’ parameters can be used to insist that the “save” must be an SQL insert or update (or equivalent for non-SQL backends), respectively. Normally, they should not be set.
